arm_group.description: Strengthening of pelvic floor muscles associated with strengthening of hip muscles.

brief_summary.textblock:
INTRODUCTION: Stress urinary incontinence is a common condition in women and can be defined
      as the involuntary loss of urine on exertion, exercise, sneezing or coughing. This pathology
      causes physical discomfort and impacts the quality of life in a negative manner.
      Physiotherapeutic exercises is a treatment with low cost and high patient attendance. It can
      be applied with focus on strengthening the pelvic floor muscles or on muscular synergism.
      OBJECTIVE: To compare the effectiveness of Kegel exercises performed alone or performed in
      association with the strengthening of the muscles of the hip in the treatment of stress
      urinary incontinence. METHODOLOGY: The study is a randomized, blinded clinical trial. It
      aims at assessing objectively the strength of the pelvic floor, the improvement in the
      number of episodes of loss and impact on quality of life. The study will accept up to 40
      women, who will be divided into two groups of physical therapy: group 1 (that will
      strengthen the pelvic floor muscles with Kegel exercises) and group 2 (that will perform
      strengthening the pelvic floor  muscles with Kegel exercises associated with the
      strengthening of muscles of the hip). The two groups will be evaluated at the beginning and
      at the end of treatment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Pelvic Floor and Hip Muscle Strengthening in the Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence

detailed_description.textblock: the strength of the pelvic floor muscles will be evaluated with the aid of a perineometer

intervention.description: Kegel exercises and strengthening of hip muscles as Gluteus Maximus and Medius and   adductor muscles

facility.name: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Pelvic Floor and Hip Muscle Strengthening in the Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence: Randomized Blind Clinical Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da Universidade de São Paulo

primary_outcome.description: number of episodes of urinary leakage per week
primary_outcome.measure: Change in frequence of urinary incontinence
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the first session of physical therapy and after 12 weeks of physical therapy treatment . The physiotherapy treatment will be held twice a week for 12 weeks.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The strength of pelvic floor muscles will be assessed qualitatively by the functional evaluation of pelvic floor and quantitatively by perineometer.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in strength of pelvic floor muscles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first session of physical therapy and after 12 weeks of physical therapy treatment . The physiotherapy treatment will be held twice a week for 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires: International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire (ICIQ); King´s Health Questionnaire (KHQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the first session of physical therapy and after 12 weeks of physical therapy treatment . The physiotherapy treatment will be held twice a week for 12 weeks.

clinical_study.source: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Sao Paulo General Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
